p: Previous observations report an increased susceptibility to infections among patients with both type 1 and type 2 diabetes mellitus, responsible of increased morbidity and mortality [17], [18], [19], [20]. Hyperglycemia may increase the virulence of different pathogens by enhancing bacterial replication and facilitating their attachment to epithelial cells favoring immune system dysfunction [21], [22], [23]. A study aimed to evaluate humoral factors in pediatric patients with type 1 diabetes showed lower IgG and C3 levels in poorly controlled disease as compared to patients with satisfactory degree of metabolic control [24].
